intro: Inula uniflora, commonly known as the singleflower-inula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is a single, showy yellow flower at the top of the stem, which blooms in late summer. Inula uniflora is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments.
